metadata.description: Comprehensive food additives database with detailed safety information, origins, and health concerns

E102.name: Tartrazine
E102.concerns: May cause hyperactivity in children; asthma trigger; linked to ADHD; banned in some countries

E104.name: Quinoline yellow
E104.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; banned in US, Australia; genotoxicity concerns

E110.name: Sunset Yellow FCF
E110.concerns: May cause hyperactivity in children; linked to cancer in animal studies; banned in Norway

E120.name: Cochineal/Carmine
E120.concerns: Not vegetarian/vegan; may cause allergic reactions; crushed cochineal beetles

E122.name: Azorubine/Carmoisine
E122.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; asthma trigger; banned in US, Sweden

E123.name: Amaranth
E123.concerns: Banned in US since 1976; cancer concerns; reproductive toxicity

E124.name: Ponceau 4R
E124.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; banned in US, Norway; cancer concerns

E127.name: Erythrosine
E127.concerns: Contains iodine; may affect thyroid; carcinogen in animal studies; banned in Norway

E129.name: Allura Red AC
E129.concerns: May cause hyperactivity in children; linked to cancer; immune system effects

E131.name: Patent Blue V
E131.concerns: May cause allergic reactions; anaphylaxis risk; banned in US, Australia

E132.name: Indigotine
E132.concerns: May cause nausea, high blood pressure, breathing issues

E133.name: Brilliant Blue FCF
E133.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; allergic reactions; banned in several countries

E141.name: Copper chlorophylls
E141.concerns: Copper intake monitoring needed; may affect zinc absorption

E142.name: Green S
E142.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; banned in US, Canada, Japan

E150c.name: Ammonia caramel
E150c.concerns: May contain 4-MEI (possible carcinogen); DNA damage in studies

E150d.name: Sulfite ammonia caramel
E150d.concerns: Contains sulfites and 4-MEI; cancer concerns; immune system effects

E151.name: Brilliant Black BN
E151.concerns: May cause allergic reactions; banned in Denmark, US, Australia

E153.name: Vegetable carbon
E153.concerns: May contain carcinogenic PAHs; banned in US

E154.name: Brown FK
E154.concerns: Banned in most countries; only UK allows in kippers

E155.name: Brown HT
E155.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; asthma; banned in Denmark, US, Australia

E160b.name: Annatto
E160b.concerns: May cause allergic reactions; IBS symptoms in sensitive individuals

E161g.name: Canthaxanthin
E161g.concerns: Eye crystal deposits at high doses; retinal damage; banned as tanning pill

E171.name: Titanium dioxide
E171.concerns: Banned in EU from 2022 due to genotoxicity concerns; may accumulate in body; nanoparticles cross blood-brain barrier

E173.name: Aluminium
E173.concerns: External use only; aluminum toxicity concerns if ingested

E174.name: Silver
E174.concerns: External use only; may accumulate in organs

E180.name: Litholrubine BK
E180.concerns: Very restricted use; only for cheese rinds which aren't eaten

E210.name: Benzoic acid
E210.concerns: May trigger asthma and urticaria; ADHD concerns

E211.name: Sodium benzoate
E211.concerns: Forms benzene (carcinogen) with vitamin C; hyperactivity in children; damages mitochondrial DNA

E214.name: Ethyl p-hydroxybenzoate
E214.concerns: Paraben; endocrine disruption; may affect fertility and reproductive system

E220.name: Sulfur dioxide
E220.concerns: Major allergen; destroys thiamine (vitamin B1); severe asthma attacks; headaches

E223.name: Sodium metabisulfite
E223.concerns: Sulfite allergen; common trigger for asthmatics

E239.name: Hexamethylene tetramine
E239.concerns: Forms formaldehyde (carcinogen); banned in most foods

E249.name: Potassium nitrite
E249.concerns: Forms nitrosamines (carcinogens); linked to colon cancer

E250.name: Sodium nitrite
E250.concerns: Forms nitrosamines (carcinogens); WHO Group 1 carcinogen for processed meat; linked to colon cancer; children at higher risk

E251.name: Sodium nitrate
E251.concerns: Converts to nitrite; same cancer concerns

E280.name: Propionic acid
E280.concerns: May trigger migraines; behavior issues in children reported

E281.name: Sodium propionate
E281.concerns: May affect behavior in children; irritability and sleep disturbances reported

E282.name: Calcium propionate
E282.concerns: Similar to E281; ADHD symptoms in some children

E284.name: Boric acid
E284.concerns: Toxic in large amounts; reproductive toxicity; restricted to caviar only

E285.name: Sodium tetraborate
E285.concerns: Very restricted use; borax toxicity concerns

E310.name: Propyl gallate
E310.concerns: May cause allergic reactions; liver and kidney damage in studies; endocrine disruption

E311.name: Octyl gallate
E311.concerns: Similar to E310; banned in some countries

E319.name: TBHQ
E319.concerns: Behavior concerns reported; DNA damage; immune system effects; banned in Japan, EU

E320.name: BHA
E320.concerns: Possible carcinogen; endocrine disruptor; tumor growth in animal studies

E321.name: BHT
E321.concerns: May cause hyperactivity; tumor promoter; immune system effects; banned in Japan

E322.name: Lecithins
E322.concerns: May be GMO if from soy; check source for vegan status

E330.name: Citric acid
E330.concerns: May erode tooth enamel with excessive consumption

E338.name: Phosphoric acid
E338.concerns: May affect calcium absorption; bone density loss; kidney damage with excessive intake

E339.name: Sodium phosphates
E339.concerns: High intake affects calcium; cardiovascular disease risk; kidney damage

E375.name: Nicotinic acid
E375.concerns: May cause flushing at high doses

E385.name: Calcium disodium EDTA
E385.concerns: Binds essential minerals; may reduce mineral absorption

E392.name: Rosemary extract
E392.concerns: May cause allergies in sensitive individuals

E407.name: Carrageenan
E407.concerns: May cause inflammation; gut damage; linked to IBS; colon cancer in animal studies; degraded form more harmful

E412.name: Guar gum
E412.concerns: May cause digestive issues; bloating, diarrhea at high doses

E415.name: Xanthan gum
E415.concerns: May be from GMO corn; digestive upset in sensitive individuals

E416.name: Karaya gum
E416.concerns: May cause allergic reactions; laxative effect

E425.name: Konjac
E425.concerns: Swells in stomach; choking hazard; banned in some countries for children

E432.name: Polysorbate 20
E432.concerns: May affect gut bacteria; microbiome disruption

E433.name: Polysorbate 80
E433.concerns: May affect gut microbiome; inflammatory bowel disease risk; metabolic syndrome in animal studies

E441.name: Gelatin
E441.concerns: Not vegetarian/vegan; from animal bones, skin, connective tissue

E450.name: Diphosphates
E450.concerns: High phosphate intake linked to cardiovascular disease; kidney damage; bone loss

E451.name: Triphosphates
E451.concerns: Similar to E450; water retention; cardiovascular risks

E452.name: Polyphosphates
E452.concerns: Water retention; kidney disease risk; cardiovascular damage

E471.name: Mono- and diglycerides
E471.concerns: May be from animal fat; often contains trans fats

E472a.name: Acetic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides

E472b.name: Lactic acid esters of mono- and diglycerides

E472c.name: Citric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides

E508.name: Potassium chloride
E508.concerns: Bitter taste; dangerous for kidney patients

E520.name: Aluminium sulfate
E520.concerns: Aluminum toxicity; Alzheimer's concerns; nervous system effects

E535.name: Sodium ferrocyanide
E535.concerns: May release cyanide at high temperatures; banned in some countries

E553b.name: Talc
E553b.concerns: Asbestos contamination risk; lung damage; banned in many applications

E621.name: Monosodium glutamate
E621.concerns: MSG sensitivity (headaches, flushing, sweating); 'Chinese Restaurant Syndrome'; may affect brain development in children

E626.name: Guanylic acid
E626.concerns: May trigger gout; avoid with high uric acid

E627.name: Disodium guanylate
E627.concerns: Often used with MSG; gout concerns; may be derived from yeast or fish

E630.name: Inosinic acid
E630.concerns: May be from animal sources; gout concerns

E631.name: Disodium inosinate
E631.concerns: Often paired with MSG; may be from fish or meat; gout risk

E635.name: Disodium 5'-ribonucleotides
E635.uses: flavor enhancer in chips, instant noodles
E635.concerns: Combination of E627 and E631; amplifies MSG effects; gout risk

E650.name: Zinc acetate
E650.concerns: High zinc intake can affect copper absorption

E950.name: Acesulfame potassium
E950.concerns: Possible carcinogen in animal studies; insufficient long-term human studies

E951.name: Aspartame
E951.concerns: Converts to methanol and formaldehyde; headaches, dizziness; phenylketonuria warning; linked to brain tumors in some studies; banned in several countries

E952.name: Cyclamic acid and cyclamates
E952.concerns: Banned in US since 1969; cancer concerns; may affect sperm production

E954.name: Saccharin
E954.concerns: Cancer concerns in 1970s (now disputed); bitter aftertaste; may affect gut bacteria

E955.name: Sucralose
E955.concerns: May alter gut microbiome; reduces beneficial bacteria; metabolic effects; generates toxic compounds when heated

E960.name: Steviol glycosides
E960.concerns: May affect blood pressure; fertility concerns at very high doses

E961.name: Neotame
E961.concerns: Similar to aspartame but more potent; limited long-term studies

E962.name: Salt of aspartame-acesulfame
E962.concerns: Combines concerns of E950 and E951

E966.name: Lactitol
E966.concerns: Laxative effect; not suitable for lactose intolerant

E967.name: Xylitol
E967.concerns: Laxative effect at high doses; extremely toxic to dogs

E968.name: Erythritol
E968.concerns: Generally well tolerated; may cause nausea in some people

E969.name: Advantame
E969.concerns: Very new (2014); limited long-term safety data

E920.name: L-cysteine
E920.concerns: Often derived from human hair or duck feathers; check source

E1105.name: Lysozyme
E1105.concerns: Not suitable for egg allergy; not vegan

E1520.name: Propylene glycol
E1520.concerns: May cause skin irritation; accumulates in kidneys and liver with high intake

MISC-001.name: Maltodextrin
MISC-001.concerns: High glycemic index; may spike blood sugar

MISC-002.name: Natural flavourings
MISC-002.concerns: Vague term; may contain unlisted chemicals
